===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|八尺瓊の勾玉}}; {{ja-l|八尺瓊の曲玉}}; {{ja-l|八尺瓊曲玉}}

===Etymology===
Phrase consisting of {{compound|ja|sort=やさかにのまがたま|八|tr1=ya|t1=[[eight]]|尺|tr2=saka|pos2=alternate reading for ''shaku'', an ancient unit of [[length]] similar to the English {{m|en|foot}}|瓊|tr3=ni|t3=[[jade]]|pos3=generally regarded as emphasizing the meaning of {{m|en|bead}}|の|tr4=no|pos4=possessive particle|勾玉|tr5=magatama|t5=[[curved]] bead|pos5=an ancient [[comma]]-shaped [[jewelry]] [[bead]] made of [[jade]] or other materials}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

A literal interpretation of the name would suggest a ''magatama'' of around eight feet in size. However, ''magatama'' were never that large. An alternate theory is that this ''magatama'' is, or was, part of an eight-foot [[necklace]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
